Landing.Title: The next generation Linux workstation, designed for reliability, performance, and sustainability.

Users.Title: You
Users.Intro: Bluefin is an operating system for your computer. The best of both worlds: the reliability and ease of use of a Chromebook, with the power of a GNOME desktop.
Users.Features: Featuring automatic image-based updates and a simple graphical application store, Bluefin is designed to get out of your way. Get what you want without sacrificing system stability. The Linux client has evolved, a clean start for the next generation. Check the [announcement blog post](https://www.ypsidanger.com/announcing-project-bluefin/) and [introductory documentation](https://docs.projectbluefin.io) for more information.
Users.BluefinArtworkAlt: Bluefin looking at the future of Linux - it's to the left apparently

EvolutionQuote.Quote: Evolution is a process of constant branching and expansion.
EvolutionQuote.Author: Stephen Jay Gould

Devs.Title: Developers
Devs.Features: Bluefin comes with an optional "developer mode" that transforms your device into a powerful workstation. It features container-focused workflows to get you started depending on where you're coming from, or bring your own. There are [15.6 million cloud native developers](https://www.cncf.io/announcements/2025/11/11/cncf-and-slashdata-survey-finds-cloud-native-ecosystem-surges-to-15-6m-developers/) in the world, wield these [industry-leading tools](https://landscape.cncf.io/) with ease...
Devs.BoxTwo: Work with your favorite Linux distributions with a container-focused terminal
Devs.BoxThree: Designed for cloud native development with the CNCF's best tools, including Kubernetes
Devs.BoxFour: Homebrew on-tap by default, same tools as your Mac
Devs.BoxFive: Podman Desktop for graphical container management
Devs.RuntimeContainers: The inclusion of a [container runtime](https://podman.io) unlocks your team's potential. Use the same tools that power modern internet infrastructure on your desktop. Bluefin knows how to ship to production.
Devs.CNJourney: We target Linux operators who don't use Linux on the desktop because it has failed them. So we're taking the Linux desktop through its cloud-native journey and building it as a community.

InitiativeQuote.Quote: Be the one who moves, not the one who is moved.
InitiativeQuote.Author: Commander Zavala (Destiny)

Mission.Title: Mission

Text.NewBreed: Bluefin is not just software, she is a new breed of animal, adapted to survive the rigors of an ecosystem dominated by giants while protecting her family.
Text.Change: We believe that the desktop experience needs to change. Technology begins with the local computer, the device that you touch, and it should be as essential as the rest of the Linux ecosystem.
Text.CloudNative: By introducing cloud-native patterns to the desktop we hope to ignite interest in desktop computing while catering to the next generation of open-source contributors. Bluefin is designed to be the tool you depend on to do what you do best. The current Linux desktop didn't get us there, but we believe that what was made, can be unmade. Let's make it better.
Text.Sustainability: Bluefin is about sustainability, encompassing the software, the hardware, and the people.

Mission.CleverGirl: Or she may disembowel us on the way. Clever Girl.

SpreadQuote.Quote: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
SpreadQuote.Author: Edith Wharton

Video.Title: Bluefin Introduction
Video.Passion: Project Bluefin is not a finished product, she is an ongoing passion project maintained by [cloud-native enthusiasts](https://github.com/ublue-os/bluefin/graphs/contributors) who seek a more reliable and maintainable Linux desktop experience. Check out the [open issues](https://github.com/ublue-os/bluefin/issues).
Video.StateOfTheArt: She represents the state of the art : a beautiful and unique creature. A perfect predator for a world that will inevitably face challenges. We must adapt. We can do it **together**.

Bazaar.Title: Applications
Bazaar.Description: Bluefin utilizes the Bazaar app store, allowing for easy installation and management of all your favorite applications from Flathub and a curated list of apps we think you'll love.
Bazaar.Additional:
Additionally, Bluefin provides Homebrew and application container workflows, making running any piece of software a breeze.

Bluefin is developed on Bluefin.

Description.Choice: Choose your raptor for your hardware and use case. The team recommends [Fedora Media Writer](https://flathub.org/apps/org.fedoraproject.MediaWriter) to create installation media, Ventoy is unsupported. Check [the documentation](https://docs.projectbluefin.io) for more information.
Description.Updates: Bluefin receives timely security updates and is available in two different streams that reflect how aggressively it receives feature updates:

Lts.Title: Bluefin LTS
Lts.Subtitle: For professionals and AI/ML engineers
Lts.Description: A long term support experience on an enterprise-grade foundation.

Stable.Title: Bluefin
Stable.Subtitle: For Everyone
Stable.Description: A modern desktop at the leading edge. Pick this if you're not sure.

Architecture.Question: Which architecture will you install Bluefin on? Older BIOS-based systems are unsupported

Gpu.Question: Who is the vendor of your primary graphics card (GPU)? Older Nvidia cards are unsupported

Kernel.Question: What is your priority? This choice balances system stability with support for the newest hardware. You can change this later:
Kernel.Regular: LTS Linux kernel: The most reliable option, perfect for most computers.
Kernel.HWE: Latest Linux kernel: Best for brand-new devices and getting the newest features.

Architecture.Title: Architecture
Architecture.X86Desc: Standard for most computers (AMD and Intel)
Architecture.ArmDesc: For ARM-based systems (Apple Silicon, Raspberry Pi, etc)

Kernel.Title: Kernel
Kernel.RegularDesc: Stable kernel updates, locked to 6.12.0 with backports
Kernel.HWEDesc: Regularly updated kernels for better hardware support

Gpu.Title: Graphics Card (GPU)
Gpu.NvidiaDesc: Nvidia RTX/GTX 16xx+ Series, GTX 10xx Series and below are unsupported

Download.Documentation:
Check out the [Bluefin Documentation](https://docs.projectbluefin.io/), it takes about 15 minutes and includes an installation runbook - set yourself up for success, you are headed into a new world.

Can't find what you're looking for? Check [the full list of downloads](https://docs.projectbluefin.io/downloads/).

If you choose secure boot during installation, the password is universalblue.

Documentation.Title: Documentation
Documentation.Description: Looking for support? View our documentation site for up-to-date guides on installation, general use, and troubleshooting.

Contribute.Title: Contribute
Contribute.Description: Assist in Bluefin's development by contributing code, reporting bugs, or making feature requests. You can also sponsor individual contributors if you'd like to contribute monetarily.

News.Title: News
News.ViewAll: View all posts on the official blog

Flock.Title: Our Flock
Flock.Description: Bluefin is built by a dedicated group of maintainers and contributors.

Footer.Title: Powered By
Footer.Copyright: Copyright {date} © Project Bluefin and Universal Blue

Project.Title: Project Bluefin is Built With
Project.Ublue: Universal Blue - A community toolkit designed to reboot the Linux desktop. Built for the love of the game. Welcome to indie Cloud Native.

Credits.Thanks: Special Thanks - [Aaron Lake](https://www.linkedin.com/in/aaron-lake/), [Brian Ketelsen](https://brian.dev/), [Dustin Kirkland](https://www.kotterva.com/), [Wayne Witzel](https://github.com/wwitzel3), & [Marco Ceppi](https://github.com/marcoceppi)
